channel.title: Portforwarding is retarded? Any help?
channel.description:
yo well im a server coder and ive been coding a server for 3 months and never bothered to check how to portforward. So i try today so i can release my server tomorrow its tp-link i put the server port as 43594, ip as 192.168.1.101 which is my ipv4 adress and the protcol as utp, and i enabled the last option. I pressed save. Started no-ip and my server, then checked on the google status page it says my server is offline. Any help? Any ideas what i can do? Could it be the source?
ANYONNEE??????

item.title: Portforwarding is retarded? Any help?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

@deathschaos9
He basically needs help portforwarding

@disastercall --> Try this site: http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/TP-Link/default.htm find your router model number. And then follow the guide to portforward a runescape private server.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding is retarded? Any help?
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“Bellend, post:8, topic:445935”][quote author=Coelho link=topic=548797.msg4023660#msg4023660 date=1340193100]

i wasnt on the router dumb ass. I tried guessing, and yes i did put that if ur not going to say something that helps then dont post.

Routing is a simple part of networking that should be easily learned when emulating the RuneScape server software. Instead of actually doing worth while work, you leeched and attempted to pretend you accomplished something so you wouldn’t look like an idiot.

Mission failed. Idiot.
[/quote]

No, Your the idiot… how is he supposed to learn without making a server in the first place… you learn by experimenting, and if that doesn’t work you get told, then you repeat it until its stuck in your head, so please think before you flame on peoples post…

@OP Tut:

  1. go to CMD, type ipconfig, find your default gateway
    and grab the local IP

  2. go to a web browser and paste the IP in and hit enter

  3. you will be asked to login, if you know your username and pass for you router
    attempt to login, if not its usual Admin, and nothing

  4. once on the router look for something like advanced, or virtual servers, or port forwarding, or services
    this depends on the router you have, if you have a firewall on your router you want to add the service to your IP on your network
    then allow the connection in the firewall by clicking new rule.

  5. Done if you have more problems PM me your TV ID and pass :P[/quote]
    You don’t pretend to be something you are not.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding is retarded? Any help?
item.dc:creator: @Bellend Bellend
item.description:
@Bellend wrote:

[quote=“Coelho, post:6, topic:445935”][quote author=disastercall link=topic=548797.msg4023659#msg4023659 date=1340192763]
i wasnt on the router dumb ass. I tried guessing, and yes i did put that if ur not going to say something that helps then dont post.
[/quote]
Routing is a simple part of networking that should be easily learned when emulating the RuneScape server software. Instead of actually doing worth while work, you leeched and attempted to pretend you accomplished something so you wouldn’t look like an idiot.

Mission failed. Idiot.[/quote]

No, Your the idiot… how is he supposed to learn without making a server in the first place… you learn by experimenting, and if that doesn’t work you get told, then you repeat it until its stuck in your head, so please think before you flame on peoples post…

@OP Tut:

  1. go to CMD, type ipconfig, find your default gateway
    and grab the local IP

  2. go to a web browser and paste the IP in and hit enter

  3. you will be asked to login, if you know your username and pass for you router
    attempt to login, if not its usual Admin, and nothing

  4. once on the router look for something like advanced, or virtual servers, or port forwarding, or services
    this depends on the router you have, if you have a firewall on your router you want to add the service to your IP on your network
    then allow the connection in the firewall by clicking new rule.

  5. Done if you have more problems PM me your TV ID and pass

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding is retarded? Any help?
item.dc:creator: @Vodzila Vodzila
item.description:
@Vodzila wrote:

Did you download no-ip and select the host then save it?
if you didn’t heres the link
http://www.no-ip.com/downloads.php
Install it. Log in. Select the host and check it off. And save it.
Also i check if my server is working here http://tinyurl.com/d5nmnow

Read full topic
